file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 31-34-01-04 - CONFIG-1 - OQAR DISK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OQAR DISK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures: • To remove the optical disk from the OQAR (OQAR Powered and OQAR Unpowered). • To install the optical disk in the OQAR. B. The OQAR is installed in the rear electronic compartment. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR OPTICAL DISK - REMOVAL (OQAR 31-34-01-000-801-A OQAR POWERED) AIRCRAFT WITH 31-34-01-400-801-A OQAR OPTICAL DISK - INSTALLATION OQAR AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR OPTICAL DISK - REMOVAL (OQAR 31-34-01-000-802-A OQAR UNPOWERED) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-34-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 2. OQAR OPTICAL DISK - REMOVAL (OQAR POWERED) A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the recorded data disk from the OQAR with power available (OQAR energized). (2) A delay can occur before the disk ejection because it is necessary to flush the data from the non-volatile buffer to the disk. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section I - right side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Remove the recorded disk Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A (1) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Open door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). J. Optical Disk Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) On the OQAR front panel, make sure that the POWER ON indicator is on. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Open the OQAR front access door. (3) Remove the optical disk as follows: (a) Momentarily push the EJECT pushbutton. Result: 1 The OQAR display shows EJECTING DISK, FLUSHING, then EJECTING DISK/PLEASE WAIT. 2 The FAIL indicator comes on. 3 The disk ejects. 4 The LOW CAPACITY indicator comes on. 5 The INSERT DISK message is shown on the OQAR display. (4) Put the disk in a protective box. (5) Close the OQAR front access door. (6) Send the disk to the analysis department. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-005-A (1) Close door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR OQAR Disk - Removal (OQAR Powered) Figure 401 DOOR 272DR A B ZONE 272 DET. B 145AMM310181.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. DET. A O

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-34-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 3. OQAR OPTICAL DISK - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the optical disk into the OQAR. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially 3.5 inch (90 mm) Rewritable Magnetic Record the data 1 available Optical Disk (ISO10090 128 Mbyte) F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Install the disk Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-006-A (1) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the QAR circuit breaker is closed. (3) Open door 272DR (rear electronic compartment). J. Optical Disk Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Make sure that the POWER ON, FAIL, and LOW CAPACITY indicators are on. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 5 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that the display shows the INSERT DISK message. (3) NOTE: An optical disk can be installed when TOO HOT or TOO COLD is shown. The LOW CAPACITY and FAIL indicators will then stay on until the unit has the normal operating temperature. Open the OQAR front door. (4) Install the optical disk as follows: (a) Put the optical disk into the recess and push in fully Result: 1 The display shows CHECKING DISK 2 LOW CAPACITY and FAIL indicators go off. (5) Make sure that the display shows the time and the date. (6) Close the OQAR front access door. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-006-A (1) Close door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 6 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR OQAR Disk - Installation Figure 402 DOOR 272DR A B ZONE 272 DET. A DET. B 145AMM310180.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 7 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-34-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 4. OQAR OPTICAL DISK - REMOVAL (OQAR UNPOWERED) A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the recorded data disk from the OQAR if power is not available (OQAR deenergized). (2) If power is not available, it is not possible to remove the optical disk with the aid of the EJECT pushbutton. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section I - right side C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Remove the recorded disk Rear electronic compartment H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-007-A (1) Open door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). I. Optical Disk Removal (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-005-A (1) NOTE: Use the manual ejection method to remove the optical disk from the drive unit only as a last resort. Open the OQAR front access door. (2) Remove the eject tool which is stored in the SPARE DISK storage drawer. CAUTION: USE THE MANUAL EJECTION METHOD VERY CAREFULLY TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE PARTS OF THE OQAR DRIVE UNIT. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Put the eject pin into the pin hole visible at the right bottom side of the optical disk drive. (4) Remove the optical disk. (5) Replace the eject pin in the SPARE DISK storage drawer. (6) Close the OQAR front access door. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-007-A (1) Close door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-01 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
